title: Order Matters!
text:
As I was writing a paper for one of my classes, I turned to ChatGPT for help with synonyms. I used to refer to the thesaurus, but the ease and amount of options made ChatGPT the obvious resource to use‚Ä¶ Or so I thought.
ChatGPT in the past allowed me to input the most simple request, and it would immediately output what I was looking for. But for some reason, the day I went to request a synonym for ‚Äúregarding‚Äù, the LLM was stuck!



regarding synonym



Could you please provide more context or specify the word you need a synonym for? This will help me provide a more accurate suggestion.

Of course, I understood that ChatGPT was processing an incomplete request to do something with the word synonym from the conversation above, but I was shocked that its first instinct wasn‚Äôt just outputting the synonym. So then I typed‚Ä¶




synonym for regarding



A synonym for ‚Äúregarding‚Äù could be ‚Äúconcerning,‚Äù ‚Äúrelating to,‚Äù ‚Äúpertaining to,‚Äù ‚Äúin relation to,‚Äù or ‚Äúwith respect to.‚Äù Each of these alternatives can be used interchangeably with ‚Äúregarding‚Äù to indicate the subject of discussion or consideration.

Just an interesting experience I had regarding the order of words using LLMs! For us native English speakers, the ordering shouldn‚Äôt make a difference (especially when inflections, tone, and context are implied), but it‚Äôs hard for an LLM to guess our interpretation 100% of the time. Remember to prompt your LLM as accurately and direct as possible for the best results!

title: ROYGBIV + AI?
text:
There has been a lot of online ruckus about how AI is stifling the creation of art and originality. However, I beg to differ. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I don‚Äôt believe that AI should be used to write full movie scripts or to create paintings that belong in the Louvre, but as I thought about some of the possibilities we can do with LLMs, I was intrigued. So I decided to see just how much creative damage I could do‚Äì beginning with creating a new color.
I start with asking Bing‚Äôs Copilot:
create a new color
The LLM responds very kindly giving me lots of imaginative options to choose from:
Certainly! Creating a new color can be a delightful and imaginative process. While I can‚Äôt mix actual pigments, I can certainly help you conceptualize a unique color. Let‚Äôs embark on this colorful journey together!

Sunset Coral: Imagine a warm blend of rosy pink and golden orange, reminiscent of a vibrant sunset over the ocean. This color exudes warmth, energy, and a touch of romance.
Stardust Teal: Picture a deep, mystical shade that combines the richness of midnight blue with a hint of emerald green.
Moonstone Lavender: Close your eyes and envision a soft, ethereal hue‚Äîpale lavender with a subtle shimmer, like moonlight dancing on water. It‚Äôs calming, dreamy, and perfect for serene spaces.
Galactic Plum: Take the intensity of royal purple and infuse it with cosmic energy. This color feels otherworldly, like a distant galaxy swirling in shades of plum and indigo.

Remember, these colors exist only in our imagination, but you can play with them in your mind or even use them as inspiration for your next creative project! üåà‚ú®
I was the most curious about Stardust Teal and Moonstone Lavender, but I couldn‚Äôt help but think that I‚Äôve seen very similar variations of these colors already‚Ä¶ meaning it didn‚Äôt do it‚Äôs job in creating a new color. So I decided to find a color that I thought matched closest to the description and see how different it is the what Copilot created for me.

title: ROYGBIV + AI?
text:
Closing Remarks
It would be interesting to see how different Copilot is to Dall-E 3 in interpreting color descriptions, but if Dall-E 3 and I agree for 2/2, then I think Copilot must be pretty similar as well.
After all of this, I think it‚Äôs important to note that I was not blown away or shocked by either of these colors, and it‚Äôs because I have seen them before. This means that AI cannot create new colors‚Ä¶ at least, not with the prompt that I supplied it with this time.
Thanks for tuning in!
Emmy

title: About
text: About this blog I‚Äôm having fun learning about LLM systems and I‚Äôm writing here to discuss my observations !!!!!

title: A test post
text:
Read the following and see if you can answer the question:


There are three boxes in a stack. A pink one, a purple one and a green one. The pink one is in the middle of the stack with the purple below it. What is the color of the box on the bottom of the stack?

Most likely you answered purple‚Ä¶
But it is possible you first said green (don‚Äôt worry if you did it is quite a common response!)


It‚Äôs a verbal visual problem that requires some deliberation and most likely for us to create a visual image of a stack of boxes as a reasoning aid.
Notice also the complexity of the language used in the prompt to describe the scene. The use of natural language as opposed to a formal/logical calculus does hold the potential for ambiguity (multiple interpretations) and inexactness. However, it is the most normal/natural, efficient and broadly accessible way of communicating such information.
Notice 1. The use of anaphor or reference. - Three BOXES -> a pink/purple/green ONE as opposed to a pink box, a purple box and a green box. - The PINK ONE is in the middle ... the purple {BOX} below IT {the pink box}
We tend to try and avoid this kind of repetition to make our speech more coherent.

Although the description in language may not be entirely concise, there is no real ambiguity as to how the boxes can be arranged. It must be: | Box | Stack position | | ‚Äî | ‚Äî | | GREEN | top | | PINK | middle | | PURPLE | bottom |




GPT3.5 Turbo

Had some difficulties and answered green
Llama2 (chat 7B version)


Answered correctly (purple) and used some so-called chain-of-thought reasoning

Bing Chat (MS Co-pilot)
This LLM is GPT4 with some Microsoft specific tuning and RAG (search) additions.
It get‚Äôs it correct:

The color of the box on the bottom of the stack is purple. This is because the purple box is below the pink one, which is in the middle of the stack. Therefore, the purple box must be the lowest one. üü™

But when you follow up and ask it to create visual representation of the box arrangement

PROMPT: Can you create a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged?

It responds

RESPONSE: Sure, I‚Äôll try to create that. Here is a visual representation of how the boxes are arranged:

And uses DALL-E3 to create 4 different attempts at a visual representation:

NONE OF WHICH ARE CORRECT!!!
